section_title: Meniscal Repair or Meniscectomy - Chronic Degenerative (Evidence: pg no: 10, L441)
names: Chronic degenerative meniscal tear (Evidence: pg no: 10, L441)
description: Meniscal repair or meniscectomy for chronic degenerative meniscal tear without history of significant acute trauma (Evidence: pg no: 10, L442-L443)
scope: Treatment of chronic degenerative meniscal tears (Evidence: pg no: 10, L441-L456)

documentation: Physical exam findings of at least TWO: Joint swelling or effusion, Positive McMurray or Apley test, Joint line tenderness, or Reduced range of motion (Evidence: pg no: 10, L444-L448)
Persistent or frequent mechanical symptoms or failure of conservative management for at least 3 months (Evidence: pg no: 10, L449-L450)
Imaging demonstrating a meniscal tear consistent with clinical presentation (Evidence: pg no: 10, L451)
X-ray findings demonstrating no more than moderate osteoarthritis (Evidence: pg no: 10, L452-L456)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscectomy (medial AND lateral, including any meniscal shaving) including debridement/shaving of articular cartilage (chondroplasty), same or separate compartment(s), when performed (Evidence: pg no: 16, L709-L710)

Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscectomy (medial OR lateral, including any meniscal shaving) including debridement/shaving of articular cartilage (chondroplasty), same or separate compartment(s), when performed (Evidence: pg no: 16, L711-L712)
Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscus repair (medial OR lateral) (Evidence: pg no: 16, L713)
Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscus repair (medial AND lateral) (Evidence: pg no: 16, L714)
